description: Largest integer a(n) for which the integer interval [ 0,a(n) ] is a subset of the set of determinants of all n X n 0-1 matrices.
comments: A definition for a(n) is given in Craigen's paper. The table given there suggests a(9)=102. Term for term, this sequence is one less than the sequence A013588.
references: R. Craigen, The Range of the Determinant Function on the Set of n X n (0,1)-Matrices, J. Combin. Math. Combin. Computing, 8 (1990) pp. 161-171.
links: G. R. Paseman, A Different Approach to Hadamard's Maximum Determinant Problem
example: There is a 7x7 0-1 matrix with determinant 20, but no 7x7 0-1 matrix with determinant 19.
author: Gerhard R. Paseman (paseman(AT)prado.com)
